thread.title: Day Trippin': Prairie Days gets down home in Edgar Springs
thread.title_full: Day Trippin': Prairie Days gets down home in Edgar Springs

author: Eddie O'Neill, The Rolla Daily News
title: Day Trippin': Prairie Days gets down home in Edgar Springs
text: Lil Mr. and Mrs. Edgar Springs — 6 p.m., city parkGospel sing — 7 p.m., city park Friday, Aug. 14 Ice cream social — 6 p.m., city hallCar show/games — 6-8 p.m., uptownOriental dancers — 7 p.m., uptownKaraoke by Miller Time Music — 8 p.m., uptown Saturday, Aug. 15 Parade lineup — 10:30 a.m., Saddle ClubParade — 11 a.m., uptownRib cook-off and Irish girl dancers — Noon, Lions ClubExtreme cowboy race — 1-5 p.m., Saddle ClubHeee Haw —5-8 p.m., fire houseStreet dance featuring Collin Nash, 8 p.m., uptownVendors and games will be available all day Sunday, Aug. 16 Barbecue and corn hole tournament — 1 p.m., Lions Club It's been "30 years in the making." That is the theme for this year's Edgar Springs Prairie Days this weekend at the Edgar Springs city park. According to longtime resident Carrie Edgar, the event began as a way to bring the community together. "It was a homecoming of sorts," she said. "We did it in conjunction with the Lions Club annual barbecue." The barbecue is still a Sunday afternoon tradition and the four-day event is bringing back another beloved tradition — "Heee Haw." The on-stage program, which will be held Saturday night, Aug. 15, from 5 to 8 p.m. in front of the fire house. It will be a parody of the popular TV show, "Hee Haw." "We had to stop doing the show around 15 years ago due to copyright laws," said event organizer Cheryl Newman. "So we added an 'e' to Hee and the show is back by popular demand." The Lil Mr. and Mrs. Edgar Spring Prairie Days contest has five boys and two girls registered this year. The pageant will take place at 6 p.m. Thursday at the city park. Newman told The Rolla Daily News that another added attraction this year is a flea market, which will be held on Saturday at the city park. There will around 25 vendors selling a variety of items. As in years past, the parade will take place Saturday beginning at 11 a.m. Also, popular country music singer and guitar player, Colin Nash, will be the closing act Saturday at 8 p.m. "Come on down and see what a great community we have here," Newman said. By Eddie O'Neill, The Rolla Daily News The Lake News Online By Eddie O'Neill, The Rolla Daily News Posted Aug. 13, 2015 at 3:00 PM
